relationships.description: Leah works for Lisa's non-profit Verse Video Education
Leah is contacting Jeffrey to help obtain a release from Woody Allen
Lisa New is a Harvard Professor

analysis.purpose: To request Jeffrey's assistance in obtaining a release from Woody Allen for educational footage and to showcase the project's prestigious participants
analysis.significance: Shows connections between educational initiatives and high-profile individuals, including political figures and celebrities

concerns: Copyright release needed for footage usage

notable_quotes: If Woody Allen agrees to let us use the footage, he will be in distinguished company. To date, we have filmed conversations about poetry with dozens of distinguished Americans including: Bill Clinton, Al Gore, John McCain, Mayor Rahm Emanuel, Mayor Tom Menino, Supreme Court Justice Elena Kagan, Sir Mervyn King, Former Secretary of the Treasury Larry Summers
The initiative, Poetry in America, includes a HarvardX online course, a television series we're creating with WGBH to be paired with PBS LearningMedia segments for the classroom

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - this is a straightforward professional request for assistance with a release form

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a legitimate educational project request

public_knowledge.context: Educational initiatives involving high-profile figures often receive media attention, though this specific request appears to be routine project coordination

analysis.summary: Leah Reis-Dennis, operations head for Lisa New's non-profit Verse Video Education, contacts Jeffrey to request assistance in obtaining a release from Woody Allen for educational footage. The project involves high-profile participants including political figures and aims to bring poetry into mainstream education through various platforms including HarvardX courses and PBS television series.
